text: Both unpowered and powered repeaters have extra, unobtainable item forms corresponding to their block IDs. They can be obtained via inventory editors with numeric item IDs 93 and 94.
Unpowered redstone repeater items can be obtained from the newly added debug chests, mainly from the 8th slot of the 4th chest from the left, and the 22nd slot of the 7th chest from the left.
Powered redstone repeater items can be obtained from the newly added debug chests, mainly from the 9th slot of the 4th chest from the left, and the 23rd slot of the 7th chest from the left.
Debug chests no longer spawn, preventing unpowered and powered redstone repeater items from being obtained this way.
Unpowered and powered items can now be obtained in singleplayer worlds via the /give command using the respective numeric ID.
The direct item forms of unpowered and powered repeaters have been removed from the game. They can no longer exist as an item in any way, only as a placed block.
Redstone repeaters probably exist as an item.
The unpowered repeater item uses this texture in inventories, when held in first or third person view or as a dropped item.
The unpowered repeater item now uses the aforementioned texture when in an item frame.
The unpowered repeater item now uses this texture in inventories, when held in first or third person view, as a dropped item or when in an item frame.
This is due to major texture storage changes in this version.
The powered repeater item uses this texture in inventories, when held in first or third person view or as a dropped item.
The powered repeater item now uses the aforementioned texture when in an item frame.
The powered repeater item now uses this texture in inventories, when held in first or third person view, as a dropped item or when in an item frame.
This is due to major texture storage changes in this version.
